field.label: Domain
field.help: Enter a domain name or IP address. For a base domain, use example.com or opn.example.com. Using a base domain enables automatic Let's Encrypt and ZeroSSL certificates by default. For a wildcard domain, use *.example.com. Only use wildcard domains with wildcard certificates, which require a DNS Provider.

field.label: Port
field.help: Leave empty to use ports 80 and 443 with automatic redirection from HTTP to HTTPS or choose a custom port. Don't forget to allow these ports with a Firewall rule.

field.label: Dynamic DNS
field.help: Enable or disable Dynamic DNS. Requires a DNS Provider in General Settings. The DNS records of this domain will be automatically updated.

field.label: DNS-01 Challenge
field.help: Enable or disable the DNS-01 challenge for this domain. Requires a DNS Provider in General Settings. This is mostly only needed for wildcard domains, or when the HTTP-01 and TLS-ALPN-01 challenge can't be used due to restrictive firewall policies.

field.label: HTTP-01 Challenge Redirection
field.help: Enter a domain name or IP address. The HTTP-01 challenge will be redirected to that destination. This enables an ACME Client behind Caddy to serve "/.well-known/acme-challenge/" on port 80. Caddy will reverse proxy the HTTP-01 challenge for this domain, and will still issue a certificate using the TLS-ALPN-01 challenge or DNS-01 challenge for itself. This option can be used for High Availability when using Caddy with a master and backup OPNsense.

field.label: Custom Certificate
field.help: Choose a custom certificate from System - Trust - Certificates for this domain. Make sure the full chain has been imported.

field.label: Access List
field.help: Select an Access List to restrict access to this domain. If unset, any local or remote client is allowed access.

field.label: Basic Auth
field.help: Select Users to restrict access to this domain. Basic Auth matches after Access Lists. If unset, any user is allowed access. When using CrowdSec, authorization failures will result in automatic bans.

field.label: HTTP Access Log
field.help: Enable HTTP request logging for this domain and its subdomains. This option is mostly used for troubleshooting, audits and CrowdSec. It will log every single request.
